title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Large quantities of charcoal, and the remains of a strongly built round tovrer, 24 feet diameter,  were lately found buried under the soil. From the top of Dechmont there is a view on clear days of Glasgow and Strath Clyde — one of the most crowded with life and business in Scotland, environed with lofty hills of picturesque outline. Towards the SE.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Leaving Glasgow by railway, the train proceeds eastward by Rutherglen, Cambuslang, and Elan tyre to Hamilton. The tourist may halt for an hour at Cambuslang for a walk to the top of the curious basaltic hill of Dechmont (the sort of peace),

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: Howbeit, ourbeasts being some-deal spent already, and there being no sicthing in the whole place as a fresh mount, we had to contentourselves with a pace that lagged behind our desire. But, certes,it was well for us that it was so : we were indeed gotten pastBlantyre, some three miles or thereabouts, to a place—a sownweel sheltered bit of road that ran for some distance by a hillcalled Dechmont, where was a fair and weel biggit mailin, whenwe encountered a horseman covered with dust, and somethingelse, spurring at break-neck speed.
